alignment_workflow.description: Indicate the alignment workflow or pipeline used for alignment of unaligned reads.

term.description: A 128-bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

visit_id.description: The submitter_id of a subject's visit in the study.

workflow_link.description: A hyperlink or storage location for the workflow used.

term.description: Generic name for the workflow used to analyze a data set.

workflow_version.description: The version number of the workflow.

aliquot.description: A portion of the original sample.

aliquot_container.description: The device in which the final aliquot is held.

aliquot_volume.description: The initial volume of the aliquot.

aliquot_weight.description: The initial weight of the aliquot.

analyte_qc_class.description: Term that best describes the analyte's QC Class.

analyte_type.description: Any aspect of an aliquot used in an analysis or assay to characterize the sample. These aspects range from molecules, such as DNA and RNA, that can be extracted from the aliquot to general descriptions of the aliquot's components, such as cell count and morphology (e.g., DNA, RNA, Leukocytes).

clinical_or_contrived.description: Is the aliquot clinical or contrived?

concentration.description: Concentration of the analyte in the aliquot.

concentration_units.description: The units used for the analyte's concentration in the aliquot.

contrivance_method.description: The name or general description of the contrivance(s) added to the biological aliquot. Alternatively, if you have provided a contrivance protocol, enter its file_name here.

term.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

days_to_aliquoting.description: The amount of time, in days, between the date used for index and the time the aliquot was separated from the whole sample.

days_to_assay.description: The amount of time, in days, between the date used for index and the assay used to address this analyte.

Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

isolation_method.description: The name or general description of the method used to isolate the analyte. Alternatively, if you have provided a protocol, put the file_name here.

label_name.description: The name of the label used in preparation of the analyte for analysis (e.g., Biotin).

label_protocol.description: The protocol used to label the analyte (please either provide link to protocol/file or describe in free text).

term.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

aliquot.title: Aliquot

sample.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products. In the case of contrived samples, it describes any material obtained from a normal donor.

anatomic_site.description: The term that best describes the primary anatomic site of the collected sample.

anatomic_site_other.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'anatomic_site', enter the anatomic site here.

comments.description: General comments about the sample or sampling procedure.

composition.description: The term that best describes the composition of the sample.

term.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

days_to_collection.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was collected.

days_to_frozen.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was frozen.

days_to_shipped.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Event and the date the sample was shipped.

device_used.description: List device(s) used for procuring the sample.

fasting_status.description: Fasting Status at the time of sample collection
enum: Not Fasted, No Low Fat Diet

term.description: A 128-bit identifier. Depending on the mechanism used to generate it, it is either guaranteed to be different from all other UUIDs/GUIDs generated until 3400 AD or extremely likely to be different. Its relatively small size lends itself well to sorting, ordering, and hashing of all sorts, storing in databases, simple allocation, and ease of programming in general.

laterality.description: The side of the organ or body the biospecimen was taken from (e.g., 'Left' if 'anatomic_site' was 'Lung' and it was taken from the left lung)

preservation_method.description: The text term that describes the method used to preserve the biospecimen after collection.

procured_or_purchased.description: Was the biospecimen purchased from a vendor or procured from a study participant.

procurement_method.description: The term that best describes the method used to extract the sample from the subject.

procurement_method_other.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for 'procurement_method', specify the method of sample procurement here.

term.description: Unique ID for any specific defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement.

sample_container.description: The type of container used for sample collection.

sample_id.description: In cases where the same biospecimen is used by multiple institutions, a deidenfitied id may be provided here to tie those together. Work with your collaborators assure the same id is used for the sample in all projects.

sample_type.description: A short textual descriptor of the sample.

sample_volume.description: The initial volume of the sample in milliliters (mL).

sample_weight.description: The initial mass of the sample in milligrams (mg).

sample_year.description: The year the sample was obtained.

study_description.description: A brief, free-text description or abstract of the study being performed. For example, the hypothesis being tested and a very brief description of the materials, methods and results.

study_design.description: Summary of the goals the study is designed to discover. General description of the study's place in relation to a clinical application.

study_objective.description: The general objective of the study. What the study hopes to discover or determine through testing.

study_setup.description: A high level description of the setup used to achieve the study objectives.

study_url.description: A URL for the study's source data or the contributing organization's website.

submitter_id.description: A project-specific identifier for a node. This property is the calling card/nickname/alias for a unit of submission. It can be used in place of the UUID for identifying or recalling a node.

term.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

study.title: Study

subject.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific experiment.

accession.description: The subject's accession ID or number.

age_at_enrollment.description: The age of the study subject at enrollment; must be less than 90 years.

age_at_enrollment_gt89.description: The age of the subject at enrollment is greater than 89 years.

age_at_immigration.description: The age of the study subject at immigration, if the age is less than 90 years.

collaboration_id.description: For instances in which multiple institutions use the same patient for their respective studies, this space is used as a place to enter in the deidentified barcode, id, or other identifier for the patient. Work with your collaborators to decide on the patient's id.

comments.description: Any extra comments or notes about this subject.

term.description: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]

days_to_birth.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Date and the date of birth.

days_to_immigration.description: The number of days between the subject's Index Date and the date subject immigrated To North America.

days_to_lost_to_followup.description: The number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was lost to follow-up.

term.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

ethnicity_other.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for ethnicity, Ethnicity (free text).

experimental_group.description: The group into which this subject has been classified for this study.

term.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

index_date.description: The reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation, where a single date is obscurred by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date.

index_event_status.description: A measure of our confidence that the logitundinal structure of the study is well described as data-defined or via curation.

lost_to_followup.description: A yes/no indicator related to whether a patient was unable to be contacted for follow-up.

primary_site.description: The primary anatomical site of disease in the subject.

term.description: Unique ID for any specific defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement.

enum: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

term.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

race_other.description: If 'Other (specify)' was chosen for race, free text to describe race as collected.
